de.luis.kioskComponents.ePayment

Interface PINPad


  • public interface PINPad
    Project: LUIS ePayment

    An instance of this class allows the direct access to a pinpad and its display. The pinpad can be connected directly to the PC or wired indirectly via a controller hardware like an Artema controller.

    There are two ways to receive an instance of this class.

    • Use PaySession.getPINPad() to create an instance of this class, when the pinpad is connected directly to the PC, without any intermediate controller hardware.
    • Use PayTerminal.getPINPad() when the pinpad is wired to a controller hardware and you can only connect to the pinpad via this controller.
    It is NOT recommended to use the PINPad constructor directly.

    The successfull creation of an instance of PINPad does not establish an exclusice access to the pinpad. You have to connect() first.

    You must disconnect this exclusive connection by calling disconnect() before using another functionality of LUIS ePayment.

    Version:
    $Revision: 1.9 $
    Author:
    M. Gelfort

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        void connect()
      throws PayException
        Establishes the communication to the pinpad. This exclusive access has to be released by the disconnect() method.
        Throws:
        PayException

      • disconnect

        void disconnect()
         throws PayException
        Method to release the exclusive connection to the pinpad. You can only access the pinpad functionality, when you are connected. It is important to disconnect, when the pinpad is no longer needed or other functionality of LUIS ePayment have to be invoked.
        Throws:
        PayException

      • isConnected

        boolean isConnected()
             throws PayException
        Method to check, if a connection exists to a pinpad. You can only access the pinpad functionality, when you are connected. It is important to disconnect, when the pinpad is no longer needed or other functionality of LUIS ePayment have to be invoked.
        Returns:
        A flag, wheather an exclusive connection to the pinpad exists or not.
        Throws:
        PayException

      • setText

        void setText(short txtID)
      throws PayException
        Sends a request to the pinpad to show a predefined text with given txtID onto the builtin display. Many payment terminals allow only the use of predefined text.
        Parameters:
        txtID - The ID of the predefined text. This ID is hardware specific. For a Hypercom Artema or MAT7000 the following IDs are valid.
        ID Display text
        0x00 Anzeige wird gelöscht (Display will be deleted)
        0x01 Bitte Karte durchziehen (Please swipe card)
        0x02 Karte entnehmen (Please remove card)
        0x03 Karte verfallen (Card expired)
        0x04 Karte nicht lesbar (Card unreadable)
        0x05 Karte für Kasse ungültig (Invalid card for ECR)
        0x06 Electronic  cash  SM gesperrt (Electronic  cash  SM locked?)
        0x07 Systemfehler, bitte warten (System error, please wait)
        0x08 Karte ungültig (Invalid card)
        0x09 Karte nicht zugelassen (Card not allowed)
        0x0A Systemfehler (System error)
        0x0B PIN PAD betriebsbereit (PIN-Pad ok)
        0x0C PIN PAD nicht betriebsbereit (PIN-Pad not ok)
        0x0D Karte erneut durchziehen, Lesefehler (Swipe card again, read error)
        0x0E Bitte Karte einstecken (Please insert card)
        0x0F Karte erneut einstecken, Lesefehler (Please insert card again, read error)
        0x10 Vorgang\nabgebrochen (Process aborted)
        0x11 Karte einstecken oder durchziehen (Swipe or insert card)
        0x12 Kartendaten\nfalsch (Invalid card data)
        0x13 Bitte warten... (Please wait...)
        0x14 Chipfehler (Chip error)
        0x15 Karte erneut\neinstecken oder\ndurchziehen (Swipe or insert card again)
        0x16 LOGIN notwendig (Login required)
        0x17 Bitte Zahlkarte einstecken (Please insert payment card)
        0x18 Bitte Zahlkarte in zweiten Leser einstecken (Please insert payment card in second reader)
        0x19 Bitte Geldkarte einstecken (Please insert Geldkarte)
        0x1A Bitte Geldkarte entnehmen (Please remove Geldkarte)
        0x1B Bitte Zahlkarte entnehmen (Please remove payment card)
        0x1C Bitte\nec-Karte\neinstecken (Please insert ec card)
        0x1D Bitte\nec-Karte\nentnehmen (Please remove ec card)
        0x1E Bitte\nGeldkarte\neinstecken (Please insert Geldkarte)
        0x1F Bitte\nGeldkarte\nentnehmen (Please remove Geldkarte)
        Throws:
        PayException

      • setText

        void setText(int row,
             int column,
             java.lang.String txt,
             short[] mac)
      throws PayException
        Method to present a user defined text on the display of the pinpad. The previous text will NOT be cleared before. Because the pinpad is high security module, a text will only be presented, when its corresponding MAC key is valid. A MAC key is a special homogenious sum over the text characters, defined by a predefined algorithm, which is known only to the pinpad and the manufacturer of the pinpad. So each text has to be granted by the pinpad manufacturer before being shown on the display.
        Parameters:
        row - The row where to start the text {1..7}
        column - The column where to start the text (0..21}
        txt - The text to be shown. The text is of the form 7x22 (lines x columns). A linefeed is represented as 0x0D (\r). The pinpad uses 8bit chars. So take care that the right codepage is loaded in the firmware, when you are using language specific chars like 'ä', 'ö' or 'ü".
        mac - The corresponding MAC for the given text (an array of 8 short values).
        Throws:
        PayException

      • setText

        void setText(int row,
             int column,
             java.lang.String txt)
      throws PayException
        Method to present a user defined text on the display of the pinpad. The previous text will NOT be cleared before.
        Parameters:
        row - The row where to start the text {1..7}
        column - The column where to start the text (0..21}
        txt - The text to be shown. The text is of the form 7x22 (lines x columns). A linefeed is represented as 0x0D (\r). The pinpad uses 8bit chars. So take care that the right codepage is loaded in the firmware, when you are using language specific chars like 'ä', 'ö' or 'ü".
        Throws:
        PayException

      • setText

        void setText(int row,
             int column,
             boolean clearDisplay,
             int timeSec,
             java.lang.String txt,
             java.lang.String mac)
      throws PayException
        Method to present a user defined text on the display of the pinpad. Because the pinpad is high security module, a text will only be presented, when its corresponding MAC key is valid. A MAC key is a special homogenious sum over the text characters, defined by a predefined algorithm, which is known only to the pinpad and the manufacturer of the pinpad. So each text has to be granted by the pinpad manufacturer before being shown on the display.
        Parameters:
        row - The row where to start the text {1..3}
        column - The column where to start the text (0..15}
        clearDisplay - flag to clear the display before showing any text
        timeSec - Timeout in [sec] for the text to be shown. The method will return AFTER this timeout. This is a syncronous call.
        txt - The text to be shown. The text is of the form 3x16 (lines x columns). A linefeed is represented as '0x5C + 0x6E'. The pinpad uses 8bit chars. So take care that the right codepage is loaded in the firmware, when you are using language specific chars like 'ä', 'ö' or 'ü".
        mac - The corresponding MAC for the given text (an array of string values)
        Throws:
        PayException

      • getCustomerPIN

        java.lang.String getCustomerPIN(short timeout,
                                PINConstraints constraints)
                         throws PayException
        Method to insert a user defined PIN on the keyboard of the PINPad.
        Parameters:
        timeout - The wait time for a user to enter his PIN. When the time expires, an exception is thrown. The unit is [seconds].
        constraints - Class to define some validation check against the inserted PIN. If one of these constraints is violated, an exception is thrown.
        Returns:
        The PIN of the user, depending on the encryption format within the constraints. If no encryption is requested, the PIN is returned in clear text.
        Throws:
        PayException
